issue.title: fix NoClassDefFoundError in spigot-based server
issue.body:
From https://github.com/MrXiaoM/SweetMail/issues/51

As you see, Multiverse-Core can not works with my plugin SweetMail in a spigot-based server called `arclight`, which with no `adventure` defaultly.
My plugin SweetMail will adds the four dependencies below into my plugin classloader:
+ `net.kyori:adventure-api:4.22.0`
+ `net.kyori:adventure-platform-bukkit:4.4.0`
+ `net.kyori:adventure-text-serializer-gson:4.22.0`
+ `net.kyori:adventure-text-minimessage:4.22.0`

Multiverse-Core certainly can't find `net/kyori/adventure/text/serializer/plain/PlainTextComponentSerializer` in this situation because my plugin don't need it.

So we should check that is `PlainTextComponentSerializer` exists too.

comment.body: You should configure your plugin to shadow the adventure dependency tho.

issue.title: Improvement Idea: One-Command trops view Execution
issue.body:
Currently, trops view requires running these four commands:

``` shell
trops fetch
rm koumyo/*
trops getkm -a koumyo
trops view --web koumyo
```

Ideally, we could run everything in one go, for example:

``` shell
trops view --fetch --getkm --overwrite --web koumyo
trops view -FKO --web koumyo
```

Where:
- -F / --fetch
- -K / --getkm
- -O / --overwrite

Before improving trops view --web, I think we should first add an overwrite option to trops getkm.
- [x] trops getkm should support -O / --overwrite.

Thanks!

Need help? Create a ticket on our [support page](https://www.coderabbit.ai/contact-us/support) for assistance with any issues or questions.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR/Issue comments)

Type `@coderabbitai help` to get the list of available commands.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### CodeRabbit Configuration File (`.coderabbit.yaml`)

- You can programmatically configure CodeRabbit by adding a `.coderabbit.yaml` file to the root of your repository.
- Please see the [configuration documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/guides/configure-coderabbit) for more information.
- If your editor has YAML language server enabled, you can add the path at the top of this file to enable auto-completion and validation: `# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://coderabbit.ai/integrations/schema.v2.json`

### Status, Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Status Page](https://status.coderabbit.ai) to check the current availability of CodeRabbit.
- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

<!-- tips_end -->

# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes.Â 

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code.Â The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issuesÂ

issue.title: [Feedback] Network Console will be removed in Edge 143
issue.body:
Starting with Edge 143, the Network Console tool will be removed from Edge DevTools with no replacement. As our team shifts focus toward delivering more stable features and improving alignment with Chrome, we no longer have the capacity to maintain this tool. We recommend using the REST Client extension for VS Code for API development and testing.

If this feature is important to your workflow, we encourage you to share your feedback. Strong interest could help motivate bringing it to Chromium in the future.

comment.body:
I strongly refuse to remove Network Console in Edge, this tool is an important part of Edge Devtools and lots of developers (and me) use it every day.

Microsoft is removing more and more useful functions, if this action continues, users will leave and turn to Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox or other platforms.

Please start thinking about what developers really need.

issue.title: feat(product-collection): allow single column layout in product collection block (#60387)
issue.body: ### Submission Review Guidelines: - I have followed the [WooCommerce Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/blob/trunk/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [WordPress Coding Standards](https://make.wordpress.org/core/handbook/best-practices/coding-standards/). - I have checked to ensure there aren't other open [Pull Requests](https://github.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/pulls) for the same update/change. - I have reviewed my code for [security best practices](https://developer.wordpress.org/apis/security/). - Following the above guidelines will result in quick merges and clear and detailed feedback when appropriate. ### Changes proposed in this Pull Request: This PR enables support for a single column layout in the Product Collection block by allowing the "columns" attribute to be set to 1 as a minimum value. Changes were made in the block.json and columns-control.tsx files to implement this feature. Closes #60387 ### Screenshots or screen recordings: | After | ### How to test the changes in this Pull Request: 1. Check out the branch and build the plugin. 2. Copy the updated WooCommerce plugin folder to your WordPress setup. 3. In WordPress admin, create a new page and add the Product Collection block. 4. Verify that the "Columns" control accepts a minimum value of 1. 5. Set Columns to 1 and confirm that the products display in a single column layout both in editor and frontend. 6. Test with different product filters (Featured, New Arrivals, etc.) ### Testing that has already taken place: Tested locally on my development environment (macOS, XAMPP, WordPress 6.x). Verified block behavior in editor and frontend with sample products. ### Changelog entry - [x] Automatically create a changelog entry from the details below. #### Significance - [ ] Patch - [x] Minor - [ ] Major #### Type - [ ] Fix - Fixes an existing bug - [x] Add - Adds functionality - [ ] Update - Update existing functionality - [ ] Dev - Development related task - [ ] Tweak - A minor adjustment to the codebase - [ ] Performance - Address performance issues - [ ] Enhancement - Improvement to existing functionality

commits.message:
Implement AI-assisted validation and fraud scoring features

- Add fraudScore field to Claim entity (BigDecimal 0..1)
- Create AiValidationService with rule-based validation and LlmValidationProvider interface
- Implement FraudScoringService with z-score anomaly detection and risk analysis
- Add SummarizationService for comprehensive claim summaries
- Create RoutingService for intelligent claim routing suggestions
- Add AiController with new endpoints:
  * POST /claims/validate - validate claims with AI assistance
  * POST /claims/score - calculate fraud risk scores
  * GET /claims/{id}/summary - generate claim summaries
  * GET /claims/{id}/route - suggest processing routes
- Add comprehensive unit and integration tests for all AI services
- Configure feature flags in application.yml for AI services
- Update README with AI architecture and endpoint examples
- All tests pass and endpoints verified working locally

Co-Authored-By: RAHUL KUMAR <er.rahul.it@gmail.com>

pull_request.title: Add registration validation and more activities
pull_request.body:
This pull request adds several improvements to the school activities signup application, focusing on expanding the available activities, enforcing signup rules, and enhancing the user interface to display participant information more clearly.

### Backend enhancements

* Added six new activities to the `activities` dictionary in `src/app.py`, each with a description, schedule, maximum participants, and an empty participant list.
* Improved the signup logic in `src/app.py` to prevent duplicate signups and enforce the maximum participant limit, returning appropriate error messages if violated.

### Frontend improvements

* Updated `src/static/app.js` to display a list of participants for each activity on the activity card, including a message when there are no participants yet.
* Added new CSS styles in `src/static/styles.css` to visually format the participants section within each activity card, making the participant list clearer and more attractive.

pull_request.title: Implement AI-assisted validation and fraud scoring features
pull_request.body:
# Implement AI-assisted validation and fraud scoring features ## Summary This PR adds comprehensive AI-powered claim processing capabilities to SmartClaims360, including validation, fraud detection, summarization, and routing features. The implementation follows a pluggable architecture with feature flags and mock LLM integration for future extensibility. **Key Changes:** - Added `fraudScore` field to Claim entity (BigDecimal 0..1) - Created new `com.smartclaims360.ai` package with 4 core services - Implemented statistical fraud scoring using z-score analysis and weighted risk factors - Added 4 new REST endpoints for AI-powered claim processing - Comprehensive test suite with 18+ new tests covering unit and integration scenarios - Feature flags in application.yml for enabling/disabling AI services - Updated documentation with API examples and architecture overview **New Endpoints:** - `POST /claims/validate` - Rule-based + AI validation with hints - `POST /claims/score` - Fraud risk scoring (0.0-1.0 scale) - `GET /claims/{id}/summary` - Formatted claim summaries with risk analysis - `GET /claims/{id}/route` - Intelligent routing suggestions based on risk ## Review & Testing Checklist for Human **âš ï¸ Critical Items (5 items - please verify carefully):** - [ ] **Business Logic Validation**: Verify fraud scoring thresholds (0.7 = high risk, 0.4 = medium) and claim type restrictions (AUTO, HEALTH, PROPERTY, LIFE) match business requirements - [ ] **Security Review**: Confirm that removing `@Valid` annotations from AI controller endpoints doesn't introduce security vulnerabilities (validation now handled by AI service) - [ ] **End-to-End Testing**: Test all 4 new endpoints with various claim scenarios including edge cases (negative amounts, invalid types, missing data) - [ ] **Statistical Algorithm Review**: Validate the fraud scoring algorithm (z-score + weighted factors) produces reasonable results with your test data - [ ] **Performance Testing**: Test with larger datasets to ensure fraud scoring performance is acceptable (currently analyzes all historical claims) **Recommended Test Plan:** 1. Start application with `./gradlew bootRun` 2. Create several test claims with varying amounts and types 3. Test validation endpoint with both valid and invalid claims 4. Verify fraud scoring produces different risk levels for different scenarios 5. Check claim summaries include all expected information 6. Confirm routing suggestions match business expectations --- ### Diagram ```mermaid %%{ init : { "theme" : "default" }}%% graph TD ClaimEntity["src/main/java/.../entity/Claim.java
(Added fraudScore field)"]:::minor-edit AiController["src/main/java/.../ai/controller/AiController.java
(4 new endpoints)"]:::major-edit AiValidationService["src/main/java/.../ai/service/AiValidationService.java
(Rule-based validation)"]:::major-edit FraudScoringService["src/main/java/.../ai/service/FraudScoringService.java
(Z-score fraud detection)"]:::major-edit SummarizationService["src/main/java/.../ai/service/SummarizationService.java
(Claim summaries)"]:::major-edit RoutingService["src/main/java/.../ai/service/RoutingService.java
(Routing suggestions)"]:::major-edit LlmProvider["src/main/java/.../ai/provider/LlmValidationProvider.java
(Mock LLM interface)"]:::major-edit ClaimRepository["src/main/java/.../repository/ClaimRepository.java
(Historical data access)"]:::context ApplicationYml["src/main/resources/application.yml
(AI feature flags)"]:::major-edit Tests["src/test/java/.../ai/**
(18+ new tests)"]:::major-edit README["README.md
(Updated documentation)"]:::minor-edit AiController --> AiValidationService AiController --> FraudScoringService AiController --> SummarizationService AiController --> RoutingService AiValidationService --> LlmProvider FraudScoringService --> ClaimRepository SummarizationService --> AiValidationService SummarizationService --> FraudScoringService RoutingService --> AiValidationService RoutingService --> FraudScoringService ClaimEntity -.-> ClaimRepository Tests --> AiController ApplicationYml -.-> AiValidationService subgraph Legend L1[Major Edit]:::major-edit L2[Minor Edit]:::minor-edit L3[Context/No Edit]:::context end classDef major-edit fill:#90EE90 classDef minor-edit fill:#87CEEB classDef context fill:#FFFFFF ``` ### Notes - **Architecture**: The AI package follows Spring Boot patterns with clear separation of concerns and dependency injection - **Extensibility**: LlmValidationProvider interface allows easy swapping of mock implementation for real LLM services - **Feature Flags**: All AI services can be individually enabled/disabled via application.yml configuration - **Testing**: Comprehensive test coverage includes both unit tests for individual services and integration tests for full endpoint workflows - **Local Testing Verified**: All endpoints tested locally with curl commands and confirmed working correctly **Session Details:** - Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/aca1e08386ff4ad68946a88fa0fe64d4 - Requested by: @RahulKumar8911

pull_request.title: Issue: #330 Implement Transaction Management for Atomic Operations
pull_request.body:
CLOSES: #330

## Summary
- Implemented DatabaseTransaction utility class for atomic operations
- Automatic transaction support detection with graceful fallback to standalone MongoDB
- Updated all critical multi-write UserService operations to use transactions
- Enhanced User model with session-aware instance methods
- Comprehensive test coverage including unit and integration tests

## Changes Made
### Core Implementation
- **DatabaseTransaction.ts**: New utility class providing MongoDB transaction support
  - `withTransaction()`: High-level transaction wrapper
  - `withSession()`: Manual session management
  - `isTransactionSupported()`: Auto-detection of replica set support
  - `withFallback()`: Graceful degradation for standalone instances

### Database Layer Updates
- **UserServiceDatabase.ts**: All multi-write operations now use transactions
  - `markEmailVerified()`: Atomic email verification + token clearing
  - `updatePasswordAndClearTokens()`: Atomic password reset operations
  - `generateAndSaveResetToken()`: Atomic token generation
  - `generateAndSaveEmailToken()`: Atomic email token generation

### User Model Enhancements
- **User.ts**: Updated instance methods to accept session parameters
  - `generatePasswordResetToken()`: Now supports transactions
  - `generateEmailVerificationToken()`: Now supports transactions
  - `updateLastLogin()`: Now supports transactions

### Service Layer Integration
- **UserServiceAuth.ts**: Enhanced user creation process with atomic operations
  - User creation + email token generation now atomic
  - Improved error handling for transaction failures

### Testing
- **DatabaseTransaction.test.ts**: Comprehensive unit tests with mocking
- **UserServiceTransaction.integration.test.ts**: Real database integration tests
- All existing functionality maintained with backward compatibility

## Benefits
âœ… **Data Consistency**: Multiple database writes are now atomic
âœ… **Reliability**: No more partial state from failed operations
âœ… **Backward Compatibility**: Works with both replica sets and standalone MongoDB
âœ… **Error Handling**: Graceful fallback when transactions aren't supported
âœ… **Performance**: Minimal overhead with automatic detection
âœ… **Test Coverage**: Comprehensive testing of all transaction scenarios

## Test Results
- âœ… All unit tests pass
- âœ… Build completes successfully
- âœ… Linting passes with no errors
- âœ… Transaction fallback mechanisms work correctly

test: Add mock response for set_accel command

The console unit tests were failing because the pre-test step to set a
safe acceleration did not have a corresponding mock response in the
`MockSerial` class. This caused the test to time out and fail the
assertion.

This commit adds the necessary mock response to `robot_client.py` to
simulate the output of the `set_accel` command, allowing the unit tests
to pass.

issue.title: feat(core): add `CellAny`
issue.body: It's definitely a mistake to name `CellOnChain` `Cell`, but there is nothing we can do with that right now. To avoid more duplicate code, `CellAny` was added to represent a cell that's on-chain or off-chain.

comment.body:
> So we may actually not need ccc.CellAny

I would say it's still needed. Putting off chain outpoints into `Cell` does make sense, but will bring lots of trouble. Every place using `Cell.outPoint` will have to check if it's valid or not, making things more painful.

comment.body:
![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

This `if/else` block for saving with a session is duplicated in `generatePasswordResetToken`, `generateEmailVerificationToken`, and `updateLastLogin`. You can simplify this by passing the `options` object directly to `save()`. Mongoose will handle the case where `options` or `options.session` is `undefined`. This will make the code more concise and maintainable.

```typescript
    await this.save(options);
```

pull_request.body:
Bumps [polars](https://github.com/pola-rs/polars) from 1.32.0 to 1.32.2.
Release notes

Sourced from polars's releases.

Python Polars 1.32.2

ðŸž Bug fixes

  • Return correct python package version (#23951)

ðŸ“– Documentation

  • Add arr.len() on the website (#23944)

Thank you to all our contributors for making this release possible! @â€‹coastalwhite and @â€‹etiennebacher

Python Polars 1.32.1

ðŸš€ Performance improvements

  • Optimise BytecodeParser usage from warn_on_inefficient_map (#23809)
  • Lower extend_constant to the streaming engine (#23824)
  • Lower pl.repeat to streaming engine (#23804)
  • Remove redundant clone (#23771)

âœ¨ Enhancements

  • Lower rle_id to a native streaming node (#23894)
  • Pass endpoint_url loaded from CredentialProviderAWS to scan/write_delta (#23812)
  • Dispatch scan_iceberg to native by default (#23912)
  • Lower unique_counts and value_counts to streaming engine (#23890)
  • Support initializing from __arrow_c_schema__ protocol in pl.Schema (#23879)
  • Better handle broken local package environment in show_versions (#23885)
  • Implement dt.days_in_month function (#23119)
  • Making Expr.rolling_*_by methods available to pl.Series (#23742)
  • Fix errors on native scan_iceberg (#23811)
  • Reinterpret binary data to fixed size numerical array (#22840)
  • Make rolling_map serializable (#23848)
  • Ensure CachingCredentialProvider returns copied credentials dict (#23817)
  • Change typing for .remote() from LazyFrameExt to LazyFrameRemote (#23825)
  • Implement repeat_by for Array and Null (#23794)
  • Add DeprecationWarning on passing physical ordering to Categorical (#23779)
  • Pre-filtered decode and row group skipping with Iceberg / Delta / scans with cast options (#23792)
  • Update BytecodeParser opcode awareness for upcoming Python 3.14 (#23782)

ðŸž Bug fixes

  • Categorical namespace functions fail on Enum columns (#23925)
  • Properly set sumwise complete on filter for missing columns (#23877)
  • Restore Arrow-FFI-based Python<->Rust conversion in pyo3-polars (#23881)
  • Group By with filters (#23917)
  • Fix read_csv ignoring Decimal schema for header-only data (#23886)
  • Ensure collect() native Iceberg always scans latest when no snapshot_id is given (#23907)
  • Writing List(Array) columns to JSON without panic (#23875)
  • Fill Iceberg missing fields with partition values if present in metadata (#23900)

... (truncated)

  • b512da3 chore: Ensure clippy and rustfmt run in CI when changing pyo3-polars (#...
  • e792ea4 fix: Categorical namespace functions fail on Enum columns (#23925)
  • ec29728 fix: Properly set sumwise complete on filter for missing columns (#23877)
  • e24d694 fix: Restore Arrow-FFI-based Python<->Rust conversion in pyo3-polars (#23881)
  • 4414d67 refactor(rust): Split column_selector.rs (#23921)
  • 495d703 fix: Group By with filters (#23917)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

comment.body:
![high](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/high-priority.svg)

There's significant code duplication between the transactional operation and the fallback operation. The logic for instantiating and validating the new user is identical in both paths. This makes the code harder to maintain and increases the risk of introducing bugs if one path is updated but the other is not.

I recommend refactoring to define the `newUser` object once, then use the `withFallback` wrapper only for the database operations that differ.

error calculating structured merge diff: error building typed value from config resource:

- overlays/dev/cluster-log-forwarder-dev.yaml: Remove tenantKey
- overlays/production/cluster-log-forwarder-production.yaml: Remove tenantKey from both outputs

DEFAULT BEHAVIOR:
ClusterLogForwarder will use default label keys:
- log_type
- kubernetes.container_name
- kubernetes.namespace_name
- kubernetes.pod_name

This should resolve the final ArgoCD sync failure and enable log collection.

review.body: ## Pull Request Overview This PR enhances a school activities signup application by expanding available activities, adding signup validation, and improving the user interface to display participant information. The changes focus on preventing duplicate signups, enforcing capacity limits, and providing better visual feedback to users. - Added six new activities (Basketball Team, Soccer Club, Art Workshop, Drama Club, Math Olympiad, Debate Team) with descriptions, schedules, and capacity limits - Implemented validation to prevent duplicate signups and enforce maximum participant limits with appropriate error messages - Enhanced the frontend to display participant lists for each activity with styled UI components ### Reviewed Changes Copilot reviewed 3 out of 3 changed files in this pull request and generated 2 comments. | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | src/app.py | Added new activities and signup validation logic to prevent duplicates and enforce capacity limits | | src/static/app.js | Enhanced activity cards to display participant lists with proper handling of empty states | | src/static/styles.css | Added CSS styling for the participants section within activity cards | --- **Tip:** Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

pull_request.title: Add registration validation and more activities
pull_request.body:
This pull request adds several improvements to the school activities signup application, focusing on expanding the available activities, enforcing signup rules, and enhancing the user interface to display participant information more clearly.

### Backend enhancements

* Added six new activities to the `activities` dictionary in `src/app.py`, each with a description, schedule, maximum participants, and an empty participant list.
* Improved the signup logic in `src/app.py` to prevent duplicate signups and enforce the maximum participant limit, returning appropriate error messages if violated.

### Frontend improvements

* Updated `src/static/app.js` to display a list of participants for each activity on the activity card, including a message when there are no participants yet.
* Added new CSS styles in `src/static/styles.css` to visually format the participants section within each activity card, making the participant list clearer and more attractive.

review.body:
## Code Review

This pull request introduces a robust transaction management system using the `DatabaseTransaction` utility, which is a great step towards ensuring data consistency and atomicity for multi-write operations. The use of a fallback mechanism for environments that don't support transactions is a thoughtful addition for backward compatibility. The integration into `UserService` and the comprehensive unit and integration tests are well-executed.

My review focuses on a few key areas:
- Reducing code duplication in transactional and fallback paths to improve maintainability.
- Correctly propagating the transaction session to all database operations within a transaction to ensure atomicity.
- Optimizing the transaction support detection.

Overall, this is a very solid and important contribution. Addressing the feedback will make the implementation even more robust and maintainable.

pull_request.title: Issue: #330 Implement Transaction Management for Atomic Operations
pull_request.body:
CLOSES: #330

## Summary
- Implemented DatabaseTransaction utility class for atomic operations
- Automatic transaction support detection with graceful fallback to standalone MongoDB
- Updated all critical multi-write UserService operations to use transactions
- Enhanced User model with session-aware instance methods
- Comprehensive test coverage including unit and integration tests

## Changes Made
### Core Implementation
- **DatabaseTransaction.ts**: New utility class providing MongoDB transaction support
  - `withTransaction()`: High-level transaction wrapper
  - `withSession()`: Manual session management
  - `isTransactionSupported()`: Auto-detection of replica set support
  - `withFallback()`: Graceful degradation for standalone instances

### Database Layer Updates
- **UserServiceDatabase.ts**: All multi-write operations now use transactions
  - `markEmailVerified()`: Atomic email verification + token clearing
  - `updatePasswordAndClearTokens()`: Atomic password reset operations
  - `generateAndSaveResetToken()`: Atomic token generation
  - `generateAndSaveEmailToken()`: Atomic email token generation

### User Model Enhancements
- **User.ts**: Updated instance methods to accept session parameters
  - `generatePasswordResetToken()`: Now supports transactions
  - `generateEmailVerificationToken()`: Now supports transactions
  - `updateLastLogin()`: Now supports transactions

### Service Layer Integration
- **UserServiceAuth.ts**: Enhanced user creation process with atomic operations
  - User creation + email token generation now atomic
  - Improved error handling for transaction failures

### Testing
- **DatabaseTransaction.test.ts**: Comprehensive unit tests with mocking
- **UserServiceTransaction.integration.test.ts**: Real database integration tests
- All existing functionality maintained with backward compatibility

## Benefits
âœ… **Data Consistency**: Multiple database writes are now atomic
âœ… **Reliability**: No more partial state from failed operations
âœ… **Backward Compatibility**: Works with both replica sets and standalone MongoDB
âœ… **Error Handling**: Graceful fallback when transactions aren't supported
âœ… **Performance**: Minimal overhead with automatic detection
âœ… **Test Coverage**: Comprehensive testing of all transaction scenarios

## Test Results
- âœ… All unit tests pass
- âœ… Build completes successfully
- âœ… Linting passes with no errors
- âœ… Transaction fallback mechanisms work correctly
